title: Newly-elected Speaker to face baptism of fire by replacing John Bercow days before Brexit Bill deadline
text:
The next House of Commons Speaker could face a baptism of fire by having to adjudicate over the final stages of Boris Johnson's Brexit deal just days after replacing John Bercow.

Jacob Rees-Mogg, the Leader of the House of Commons, confirmed that the expected election for a new speaker will take place on Monday November 4.

Nine MPs are running to replace Mr Bercow including Labour MPs Chris Bryant, Lindsay Hoyle and Rosie Winterton, and Tory MPs Sir Henry Bellingham and Shailesh Vara.

If MPs agree with Mr Johnson's timetable it will mean that the winning candidate will take over the Speaker's chair will be announced just days before Mr Johnson's deadline to pass the Withdrawal Agreement Bill...
